Remaining scenarios for Playoffs & Worlds

• ⁠DWG – DRX – GEN – AFS – T1: DRX 140, GEN 140, T1 110, AFS 40, KT 10
• ⁠DRX – DWG – GEN – AFS – T1: GEN 140, DWG 120, T1 110, AFS 40, KT 10
• ⁠DWG – GEN – DRX – AFS – T1: GEN 160, DRX 120, T1 110, AFS 40, KT 10
• ⁠GEN – DWG – DRX – AFS – T1: DWG 120, DRX 120, T1 110, AFS 40, KT 10
• ⁠DWG – DRX – AFS – GEN – T1: DRX 140, GEN 110, T1 110, AFS 70, KT 10
• ⁠DRX – DWG – AFS – GEN – T1: DWG 120, GEN 110, T1 110, AFS 90, KT 10
• ⁠DWG – AFS – DRX – GEN – T1: DRX 120, GEN 110, T1 110, AFS 90, KT 10
• ⁠AFS – DWG – DRX – GEN – T1: DWG 120, DRX 120, GEN 110, T1 110, KT 10

To qualify for Worlds without gauntlet:

DWG:

• ⁠Win the split: 4/8 = 50%. If not,
• ⁠GEN ends 4th: 2/8 = 25%
• ⁠GEN wins the split: 1/8 = 12.5%

% chance of making Worlds: 7/8 = 87.5%

DRX:

• ⁠Win the split: 2/8 = 25%. If not,
• ⁠Finish above GEN, while DWG wins the split: 3/8 = 37.5%

% chance of making Worlds: 5/8 = 62.5%

GEN:

• ⁠Win the split: 1/8 = 12.5%. If not,
• ⁠Finish 2nd: 1/8 = 12.5%. If not,
• ⁠Beat AFS, and DRX wins the split: 1/8 = 6.25%

% chance of making Worlds: 3/8 = 37.5%

AFS:

• ⁠Win the split: 1/8 = 12.5%

% chance of making Worlds: 1/8 = 12.5%

EDIT: T1 has no chance of making Worlds anymore via Championship Points: they have to go through the gauntlet.
